ai.summary: Curlews, Convicts & Contraband is a hard 21.2 km hike in the UK designed for experienced walkers. The route combines challenging terrain and elevation with a historical-themed name, demanding good fitness, navigation, and thorough preparation.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail traverses varied terrain: long ascents and descents, uneven footpaths, grassy slopes, and occasional rocky or muddy sections. Expect exposed sections and areas where navigation may be needed to stay on the route.
ai.safety_notes: This is a hard-rated hike. Check the day’s weather; UK conditions can change rapidly. Wear sturdy footwear and dress in layers with a waterproof outer layer. Carry a map and compass or GPS, plus a charged phone as a backup. Bring enough water and high-energy snacks. Let someone know your plan and estimated return. In remote stretches, mobile reception may be poor; stay on marked paths. Watch footing on uneven ground, exposed rock, or mud, and be cautious near edges or livestock. If weather deteriorates or daylight fades, turn back. Carry a small first aid kit and a whistle for emergencies. Plan for tidal or coastal sections if encountered; avoid unsafe conditions.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip and ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters total)
High-energy snacks and a light meal
Map and compass or GPS device; fully charged
First aid kit and any personal medications
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Emergency whistle and lightweight emergency blanket or space blanket

seo.title: Curlews, Convicts & Contraband: 21.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore a challenging 21.2 km hike in the UK with demanding terrain and elevation. Plan ahead with gear, safety tips, and season guidance for Curlews, Convicts & Contraband.
seo.h1: Curlews, Convicts & Contraband: A 21.2 km Hard Hike in the UK
